Posts.Content: I sent you a private reply on 3-8.  I realize that these last few days have be terribly hard and I am sure exhausting to say the least.  I  hope that  I haven't scared you off.  Please, stay in touch.  There are plenty of us who care and will listen, if that is what you want.  Take care and God bless.
Posts.Title: my died from breast cancer

Posts.Content: it has been a little over 4 mths now since we lost our precious sister....the missing is never ending.....after 51 yrs.  my mind is so confused, the emptiness is unbearable.  not a day goes past that i don't feel as though i am suffocating from this devastating loneliness i have from losing her. i am not asking for sympathy...please don't say that you are sorry...i just need someone to hear my primal screams. i know that life is suppose to go on...i have been here before...only this is eating me up inside.
Posts.Title: the battle lost...now what

Posts.Content: I come to this message board once a day....I wonder  why there aren't many messages looking for a shoulder to cry on or at least an ear to bend.  Am I the only one who is having trouble coping with the fact that all of this is so overwhelming?  I handle each day as a blesssing because I have one more day with my sister.... yet I know what the reality of it all is.  I know that this is about her, not me.  I also know that I can't remember a day where she hasn't been here.  Our mom always said "that we were twins born 2 years apart." I guess I want to know how to do this...I believe in God, that this is part of life ....yet when she has so much more of life left to give, it makes me wonder if he has the right person.  I feel so helpless, that if I keep looking I will find a way to fix this for her....for me. I can't believe that we have  4 "baby" grands that won't remember who she really was....they will remember the memories that we will share so she is alive in their hearts....but not the physical memories,like her silliness, the kiss she fixed a booboo with, or flying the kites on the windiest day of  the year. I am scared  of who I will become when she isn't here anymore.  She is my right hand , she is Lucy to my Ethel.  She is my soul and my heart.
Posts.Title: at the end of day

Posts.Content: KayleighGrace, Tre and Kittcath,  we have been told that it could be anytime. She is now enrolled with Hospice. We were told in Jan. that it could be 3-4 months. I know that God is the one in charge of the timeline,not the Drs.  I can only tell that she seems to not be as strong as she has been and she is starting to sleep more.  When she feels up for a ride in the country, it doesn't take long before she is ready to go home because she is tired. Today, my husband,my son  and brother-in-law made a ramp so she doesn't have to climb stairs.  Yesterday, was the last day of doing that. She hasn't done chemo now for 4 mths.  She has had (at one time) whole head rad, and the one time she had Cyber Knife was last Sept. They had tried Tykerb and then Abraxane but they made her too sick.  So then you decide if you would rather have quantity or quality of life. She has been fighting this since 03. Started as breast cancer,now has mets in brain. She is my hero.  We are so close.  We share the same driveway, she  lives in an apartment that my husband,myself and her had built in 85. We have been best buds since forever.  Even though we have 3 other sisters, we are the two youngest and the two closest. You might be asking why I don't say all this to them....because they love her  as much as I do....I know they hurt as much as I do...it is easier not to let them see or hear where I am in this. Three years ago, we lost our mother.....seven years ago I (we) lost my oldest son.  Sometimes all of this comsumes me.  I am losing yet again someone that I love..... I pray everynight  that God be gentle and not to prolong this.  No matter how much it breaks my heart, I will not be selfish, I will let her go.  This is one trip that she will have to go without me.................
Posts.Title: at the end of day

Posts.Content: On 3/4/2009 beckbeck220 wrote: Thank yall very much for all the wonderful advice.  The mammo report came back as being "probably benign".  I'm still a little worried, but more than likely, it's just fibrocystic.  I go to the surgeon tomorrow and we'll decide where to go from there but probably all I need is repeat mammo's for a little bit!   Three cheers and a hail mary !!!!  Tomorrow is another day.  Take a deep breath and try to relax until then, okay?  I'll say a pray.  Keep in touch.
Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: On 3/3/2009 survivorchic wrote: I was misdiagnosed at age 37. I had to push & push to get a baseline mamo at 32 because my mother had breast cancer. They finally gave me one at 32. At 37 they told me the lump on the mamo was just a cyst, to lay off the cafeine & come back in 6 months. I did what the radiologist said & 8 months later I was told I had cancer, that it had spread to my lymphnodes & had to have a mastectomy! Do not wait, trust yourself & your body, we know it best! I now have reaccuring b.cancer & perphaps if all this had been caught earlier, I wouldn't be in this situation now! You have to be strong, tough and not take no for an answer. Cancer doesn't seem to care about age, so don't let these docs push you off because of that. I would get a biopsy right away & see what you're really dealing with. These people are not God & should never be cocky enough to think they know all the answers. Make that appt today & you can have some peace in your mind. Let us know how you make out-lot's of support here just ask Linda Linda, may we ask how old you are? Also, how are you doing?  your reaccurances, are they in check now or are you still fighting the beast?stage?
Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: On 3/2/2009 beckbeck220 wrote: I'm wondering how possible it is to be misdiagnosed with fibrocystic breast disease instead of cancer?  I went and had an ultrasound and mammo done today and that's what the technician for both is saying.  They were both pessimistic to begin with even doing the tests.  First I had the u.s. and the tech for that was like, "looks like fibrocystic breasts to me, but I have to let the doc decide if you need a mammo".  The doc saw a few worrisome spots so I had a mammo as well.  The mammo tech said the same thing but added, "you're too young for this to be cancer, so I'm sure it's just fibrocystic."  She even went on to tell me I should cancel my appt with the breast surgeon because it would just be a waste of money.  Are these people just disregarding me because I'm only 27?  Should I still go to the surgeon and request a biopsy?  I'm so confused and just as worried as before I had these tests done!!  Thanks!! Do not, I repeat, do not think or let them think that just because you are only 27 that this could not be  something that should be looked into.   My son ,was 27 when he was told that the palpations he was having was something  that a million other people lived with everyday.  That was June 12, 2001.  On July 4,2001 he died of Sudden Cardiac Arrest. I believed then as I do now that his age had alot to do with it.  Sometimes insurances say they don't think it would be cost effective to run a battery of tests on someone that "young". Don't take that wrong, he had had a stress test, wore an event monitor and a holter moniter.  That is where the "million of people live......"comes in. I finally got my act together and took his autospy report and previous results to my cardiologist  and within a blink of an eye he told me that what showed on the autospy was a heart defect that he had to have been born with that made me lose him.. He also said that if certain other tests would have been taken he probably would have been a 27 year old walking around  with a defrillbulater .....yet back then they only had pacemakers I know that I've gone on and on, but what I want you to do is have the biopsy.  If it comes back okay, that's okay.    Be proactive when it comes to you and your health.  You don't always get second chances.  Let us know what you find out,okay?  If it turns out it is something, there are alot of us who can always lend you an ear,  There is strenght in numbers.
Posts.Title: misdiagnosis?!?!?!

Posts.Content: On March 31, 9:15 a.m. Kelly left us.   I want to share with you the sister I love so much.  This is a little lengthy.  But the world will be a better place for having known just this much of her. What a gift our mother gave us when she had Kelly.  Most of you know she was the world to me.  Mother always said that we were Siamese twins attached at the hip, born two years apart.  You never saw one of us without the other and if you did you may have thought,,maybe there is only one of those girls afterall. Losing her, I have lost half of myself, my heart, my soul.  Truly she was a gift from God.  She was my best friend, my confidant, my partner in crime. (We never got arrested,ha ha.") When we were told that there was only a few months, we were talking one day and I asked her what was I going to do without my right hand?  She said go left.  That was Kelly, she could take a bad situation and find a way to make it positive.  Through all that she was going through...never, ever did she ask why me?  Instead she would say why not me.  Kelly was still Kelly through all of it.  She didn't want to be the poster child for cancer. Kelly was the happiest when her family was happy.  She only wanted good things for us.  It didn't matter how big or small as long as she was a part of it. She wasn't materialistic, her greatest possessions were her family.  Her love for all of us was unlimite and unconditional.  She had a unique relationship with each member of our family.  Whichever one she was with at any given time,You were it, You were the most important, accepted, without expectations,  She may not have agreed, but she never judged. The newest baby was Kelly's new toy.  She loved their innocence and couldn't get her arms opened fast enough so she could embrace them with every ounce of herself.  She was a 2nd mother to our children and our children's, children. Kelly was a giver----asking nothing in return.  Any project being done, whether it was a new house being built, she was there with hammer in hand.  A garden being planted--again she was there only this time it was with a rake or hoe. Most of you know that Kelly was independence personified.  In the last couple of months, we as a family gave her our time, our care. WE DROVE HER NUTS!  She hated that we were taking our time to give her the long deserved comfort and care she needed.  I don't know how many times she would say thank you or I'm so sorry.  She never had to say either and most of all---she never needed to apologize. Now she is in God's loving hands, hurting no more, with her beautiful smile and those sparkling eyes and we are grateful.  I ask only one thing.....God hold gently this life which you have created, now and forever. Amen. Thank you for the time you took to read this.  My world is different without her. I am proud to be her sister.  Thank you for the different times I was able to come here and get answers or to vent my  frustrations . You carried me through alot farther than I would have been able to go  by myself.
Posts.Title: My wonderful sister

Posts.Content: This falls between breast and mets in brain.  The Dr. has just increased the dosage of liquid morphine and dosage of xanax.   The morphine makes her very drowsy and I'm afraid that she will choke when taking the xanax.....may we dissolve the xanax in sugar water and give it to her with a dropper   NEED ANSWER ASAP.  Next dose of xanax is in five minutes
Posts.Title: Increase in morphine

Posts.Content: whatever you decide should be entirely up to you...it is your body it should be your choice.  best of the world to you.
Posts.Title: tempted to refurse all drugs

Posts.Content: On 1/22/2009 sgmstage4 wrote: Has anyone out there had breast cancer that left the breast and went to other parts of the body. I felt great up until just before diagnosis. I was finally diagnosed with estrogen receptive breast cancer in my stomach and in my bones. I have had radiation and now take Femara and Arredia. I have had no surgery since the MRI shows healthy breast tissue in both breast. I was told my cancer would be chronic, not one to go into remission or be cured. But I have been in complete remission for about 9 months. I know it is only a matter of time before it rears its ugly head! The Femara causes a great deal of joint pain and fatigue. But it is working. Mu cancer was referred to as "indian file" which is why it did not show up on my yearly mammograms. I will be DI nuclear scanned again at the end of Feb. Had stomach scope and biopsy in December-all clear. Just wondering if anyone else has had this???? Shirley  my sister had breast cancer starting in03 ,it has metastasized in her brain and her femur and other bones as well.In 05 she had awhole head radiation and now has had cyberknife (which is a more centralized radiationon her head in sept.  her balance has been effected but not her spirit or her ability to keep on fighting  her        oncology dr is amazed that she is still around since her first diagnoses of it relocating in her head in05. i hope that you have a strong will and a strong support group also a loving family.  GOD BLESS YOU AND YOURS.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Stage4, not in breast

Posts.Content: CONGRATULATIONS!!!!!!!  Keeo up the good work.  It is great to hear that there is someone able to defeat the beast.
Posts.Title: sixth year of remission

Posts.Content: My  typing skills are horrible ...............it is NOT your fault.  Please,excuse anymore mistakes you find.
Posts.Title: Forgot to ask

Posts.Content: I have posted here before and tonight I posted on the brain cancer forum,,they were nice to tell me to come here but then again I'm not sure if this is the right one either.  I have been reading where some loved ones have been given "X" amount of time left.  Since January my baby (51) sister is one of them. When we were told she had had a recent MRI.  She has been dealing with met.breast ca. in her cerebellum, and there are some bone involvement also.  So I guess my question is what does the Dr. know that we don't?  He said that there isn't anything new in her brain her two spots aren't really any bigger.  She takes only.5 mg of decadron twice a day.   I know there are people out there that take much more.,her pain is relieved with pain patches 100's.  What is it that tells the DRS.  that it is almost over??? Does anyone have any knowledge or experience in this? I know that every cancer is as different as the one who has it. Does anyone know how or what the progression  will be?  I will take anything as a generalzation.  Thank you, waiting for your replies.
Posts.Title: Looking for answers in all the wrong places.....

Posts.Content: If Tre is out there I would love if you reply.   I asked about mixing xanax with sugar water....no reply but that was my fault for waiting to the last minute....she was able to swallow them without any problem Now that the Dr. has started liquid morephine 2ml 1-2 hr .....what does that tell you. I have been here before.  I am the one who is losing her baby sister to metastatic breast cancer. What can you tell me about my sister's condition, or where we are in this.  We all are aware that she will never be better, are we closer to the end than what we think.  I need to know...for her, for me. Please?
Posts.Title: Forgot to ask

Posts.Content: Tre,  it is your fault that you don't know what I am talking about.  I am not so sure s to where I fit in.  Started on, caregivers, been on brain cancer and also breast cancer. My 51 sister has battled  breast cancer since 03.  In 05 it became metastasized in bones and brain.   Onto yesterday,  her Dr. put her on 2 ml of morphine every 1-2 hrs anf 2 xanax (.25 mg) every 2 hrs.  All of this has been prn.  Kelly ( my sis) is aware that this will take care of the pain, also it will make her sleep.  My "other" 3 sisters are aware of it also.  We are forunate to have Hospice. Our nurse will be here tomorrow.  They are on call on the weekends.  That is how we were able to start the morphine.  We were told last Tuesday that it could be anytime... are we closer than we think.  Kelly has stated that she is probably more ready for this than we are. With everything I have told you, do you have any advice?  I noticed the other night that you had been a RN. God bless for the work that you did and the work that you're doing.
Posts.Title: Forgot to ask
